name: Lynks
long_description: Lynks is an e-commerce company that makes high demand products accessible to people in developing countries.
one_liner: Lynks is an e-commerce company that makes high demand products…

name: Mosaix.ai
long_description: Voice AI are changing the way people interact with contents and services. At Mosaix we are building an advanced a language AI platform for enterprise, with a focus on underserved emerging markets.
one_liner: Mosaix builds the NLP for the local languages at the emerging markets.

name: Outtalent
long_description:
Outtalent helps top engineers from emerging markets get jobs abroad at companies like Google.

We started Outtalent because we believe that talent is equally distributed, but opportunity is not and emerging markets have an exceptional number of great but undervalued engineers. We believe getting a job at one of the world’s best companies sets people on a great path to realize their full potential.

Outtalent is funded by YCombinator, world-class venture capital funds, executives from Google and Facebook, and other angel investors who are passionate about our mission. We have already helped software engineers from Russia, Ukraine and Central Asia get jobs at Google, Amazon, Microsoft and many other companies in the US, Canada, and Europe.
one_liner: We help top engineers in emerging markets get jobs abroad at…

name: Popl
long_description: Capture leads, enrich validated contact & company info, and share digital business cards - at events, in the field, and beyond. Powered by AI and our proprietary data engine, Popl drives growth for companies around the world, turning every handshake into an opportunity.

name: Waza
long_description: Waza is the B2B platform for global payments and emerging market trade. We make it easy and affordable for businesses with no access to USD to fulfil their global payment obligations, treasury and liquidity needs.
one_liner: B2B payments platform for emerging markets.

name: Cleva
long_description: Cleva enables African freelancers and businesses to receive international payment for their service, while protecting themselves from local currency volatility. With a Cleva USD account, one can easily receive USD payment from anywhere in the world, spend via a card, pay bills, convert to local currency, and save in USD to hedge against local currency volatility.

name: Paasa
long_description:
Paasa helps wealthy Indians invest in global equities - without middlemen, hidden fees, or paperwork.

While high-net-worths in India often have international expenses from children's education to healthcare, most still save in INR, a currency that depreciates ~2–5% per year against the USD. Why?
- Broken outward remittance process
- Fear of making mistakes in tax or compliance
- Paper-heavy onboarding processes of international brokers
- Lack of trustworthy guidance

Paasa offers a mobile app that enables Indians to trade worldwide, invest passively, and automate every cross-border tax filing.
one_liner: Invest in Global Equities from India

name: Karsa
long_description: Karsa is a stablecoin neobank for over 100M people in emerging markets. We enable people to buy dollar-denominated stablecoins, save money in US bank accounts, and spend anywhere with a Visa card.

name: Kita
long_description:
Kita transforms messy borrower documents into structured financial signals for lenders in emerging markets. We’re not OCR. OCR reads text. Kita understands documents. We use a layered system led by visual language models and computer vision to extract the financial data lenders actually use.

In many emerging markets, open finance doesn’t exist. There are no reliable bank APIs. A borrower’s financial history is only accessible through documents: bank statements, e-wallet records, remittance slips, payslips, and receipts. Today, lenders either review these manually or rely on legacy OCR tools that break on real-world files and still require human review.

We secured a $100k paid pilot with a Philippine lender the week we built our prototype. Since then, we’ve quadrupled down with customers, shipped new features continuously, and grown ~50% month over month with lenders across multiple Southeast Asian markets.

Document parsing is our thin end of the wedge. By combining document data with historical repayment outcomes, Kita learns which signals drive loan decisions and becomes the intelligence layer for lenders in emerging markets. Southeast Asia’s fintech and lending markets are booming, projected to reach $180B by 2030, but underwriting infrastructure hasn’t caught up. Document-based decisioning has become the bottleneck, creating a $10B+ annual opportunity for modern lending infrastructure.

We’re Carmel and Rhea; we met during our gap years before Stanford and have been building together ever since. Carmel is from Manila and spent three years working in product at Apple, where she shipped an iOS feature before graduating college. Rhea received the sole highest honor in Stanford Computer Science for her work in computer vision and was previously pursuing her PhD. Together, we bring deep local context and technical execution to expand access to credit in emerging markets.
one_liner: Turn documents into financial data for lenders in emerging markets
